entry.title: Evangaline Buckley Begins
entry.summary:
Author: Not_Ren_42

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,865Chapters: 11/12Kudos: 89

Summary: Evangaline Buckley has been alone for most of her life. She was unwanted by her parents and left by her sister when she had the first chance. For her most formative years, she had to go to extreme lengths just to get attention from those meant to care for her, failing more often than not.After finding out the truth about her creation, Evie decides that she has to do something â€“ anything. She goes through even more pain and heartbreak before finding herself where she was always meant to end up.

entry.title: Evan Buckley and The Long Way Home
entry.summary:
Author: creativecyr

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 60,969Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 128

Summary: Evan Buckley wasnâ€™t born under a prophecy or with a holy choir singing in the background. He wasnâ€™t even born for himself. He was born to save a dying brother - and he failed. When Evan ran away from home on the Jeep his sister gave to him, he didn't expect to discover a dark secret within his medical files. That he was born to be a bone marrow dispenser for a dead boy - and that everyone else knew but him. He thought his parents and sister were the only ones who could give him answers - but the road trip from hell seems hellbent on proving otherwise. Thereâ€™s a dragon-snake thing in Florida. Flesh-eating horses in Montana. And an old goat-man who insists Evanâ€™s â€œObama-Care handsâ€ is totally normal, then gave him a map to some camp in the New York woods. Cool. No notes. As if unearthing family trauma wasnâ€™t enough, now Evanâ€™s weird quirks - making promises, sensing lies, the way animals listen to him - they just might mean something. Like, maybe heâ€™s a demigod. Which is definitely not a thing. Right? Because Evan Buckley might be spiraling, but even he knows better than to join a cult in the woods. Probably. Or: Demigod!Buck's five-year road trip before ending up at the 118.

entry.title: The Ghost of You
entry.summary:
Author: bvddiebro

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 114,568Chapters: 20/21Kudos: 1,260

Summary: Evan "Buck" Buckley thought he had left his past behind when he traded his Navy fatigues for turnouts. For years, heâ€™s buried the memoriesâ€”of war zones, of a lost lover, of the life he swore he'd never return to. But with a series of arson attacks across LA, his past comes back to haunt him.NCIS are called to investigate and Buckâ€™s carefully constructed web of secrets begins to crack when Sam Hanna arrives at Station 118â€”because Buck knows him. Sam was once his teammate, his mentor, his brother.When a grainy surveillance video reveals a face Buck thought heâ€™d never see again, the ground shifts beneath his feet. Zack, the man he mourned, the man he watched die, is alive.Working alongside NCIS and his old SEAL Team, Buck finds himself walking a dangerous tightrope. The deeper he gets, the more he risks everythingâ€”his job, his family, his friendships and the life heâ€™s built with Eddie and Christopher.But secrets canâ€™t stay buried forever.

entry.title: Never a Frown (With Golden Brown)
entry.summary:
Author: ratking_withnotail

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 115,112Chapters: 10/?Kudos: 720

Summary: Percy Jackson was excitedâ€”genuinely excitedâ€”for the first time in what felt like years. A new city. A new name. A new face, even. The golden hair, the pale blue eyes, the tattoos that traced his skin like constellationsâ€”none of it screamed â€œPercy Jacksonâ€ anymore. He was Evan Buckley now, or just Buck, depending on who asked. Heâ€™d keep busyâ€”physically exhausted, mentally occupied, emotionally detached. That was the key. No attachments. No friendships. No relationships. No vulnerability. Heâ€™d learned the hard way that getting close to people only ended in pain. Either they died, betrayed him, or saw the legend behind the name and stopped seeing him altogether.Unfortunately, he hadnâ€™t planned on the 118.

entry.title: The Kendall's at the 118
entry.summary:

entry.title: Beneath the Same Broken Sky
entry.summary:
Author: Buki_stories21

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 345,570Chapters: 41/?Kudos: 1,413

Summary: He stopped in front of her, like he didn't know what to say. Fiona just stared at him. Lip stirred beside her."You got a baby," he said."Two," she replied, chin jerking toward Lip.He blinked. Then, slowly, he dropped his bag and unzipped it. He pulled out a sandwich, squished, half-eaten, wrapped in a crumpled napkin, and held it out to her."You can have the rest," he said. "It's peanut butter. No jelly."Fiona hesitated. Her stomach twisted with hunger, but she'd been taught not to trust strangers, even if they were small and sad-looking like her. Still... a sandwich was a sandwich.She reached out and took it."Thanks."He sat down next to her on the curb without asking. Just dropped his backpack by his feet and let out a sigh like someone twice his age."I'm Evan," he said, picking at the edge of his sneaker sole."Fiona."

Iâ€™m going to Los Angeles.â€ When Buck finally tracks her to Safe Zone 118, he realizes that maybe having a familyâ€”and surviving alongside people who actually careâ€”isnâ€™t so bad. At 118, firefighter Eddie Diaz, a single dad, turned his fire station into a refuge with his team when Ground Zero struck. Just trying to keep his kids safe, heâ€™s thrown for a loop when a stranger shows up claiming to be Maddieâ€™s brother. Summary: And all of that was why, on their seventeenth day on Mars, Buck had shoved Eddie out of the way during the emergency evacuation, knowing it meant his own death instead of Eddieâ€™s. Buck trusted Eddie to help get everyone else home, and Eddie had someone to go home for. Someone who needed him and loved him. Someone who Buck loved, even without ever meeting. He wasnâ€™t going to let Chris grow up without a father. So in the split second he had to think after seeing the communications dish flying at them through the storm that was chasing them off the planet fourteen days early, heâ€™d pushed Eddie out of the way, hoping like hell it would be enough and knowing he wouldnâ€™t live long enough to find out.--Or, take the basic plot of The Martian and stick the 911 characters in there, slap on a lot more angst and pining, and wrap it all up with plenty of recovery cuddling.
